articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.description: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
articles.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
The bitcoin price rocketing to $24,000 amidst the banking crisis is reflecting the world’s need for a sound money alternative.
Bitcoin remained resilient in the face of a very hesitant market Monday morning, surging past $24,000. Despite fears that the cryptocurrency industry is being cut off from banking, bitcoin is outperforming the S&P 500, which, surprisingly, didn’t sustain a major hit, up 0.7% as of the time of writing.
Last night, the Federal Reserve, FDIC and U.S. Treasury released a joint statement ensuring that Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank customer money will be guaranteed. 
This morning, President Joe Biden held a press conference in which he attempted to address the nation’s banking fears. However, the nation’s Commander in Chief walked out of the conference after having finished his prewritten statement, avoiding any questions from the public. 



In the meantime, the United States is looking at two of the largest bank failures in its history.



Perhaps the more sensible place for the nation to look for reassurance is Bitcoin. Bitcoin has a stable monetary policy — there will never be more than 21 million. In addition to this, individual users of Bitcoin can sovereignly take custody of their own money utilizing seed phrases, meaning that your funds will never fall victim to the dangerous nature of fractional reserve banking..

Money in the banks are IOUs. If people do not have custody of their money, it simply isn’t theirs. As these lessons are taught in real-time, Bitcoin will continue to thrive. This key point in time is a moment of opportunity for Bitcoiners to teach others about the values of sound money, as well as the basic fundamentals of beginning their own bitcoin custody journey.
articles.title: Bitcoin Surges Past $24,000 As U.S. Sees Major Banks Fail

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
Identity theft is becoming more prevalent in today's digital world. As more of our personal information is stored online, it becomes more vulnerable to theft and misappropriation.

Blockchain technology has the potential to transform the way we manage and secure our online identities. In this article, we will look at how blockchain identity can help build a more secure future.

What is Blockchain Identity?

Identity on the blockchain is a system for managing identities that makes use of blockchain technology. In this system, an individual's identity is stored on a decentralized blockchain network that only the individual and authorized parties have access to. Individuals retain complete control over their identities, which can be verified and au…
articles.title: Identity on the Blockchain: Building a More Secure Future

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Litecoin was back in the green on March 13, as cryptocurrency markets rebounded to start the week. The token rose by as much as 15% in today’s session, with the global crypto market cap trading nearly 10% higher. Ethereum classic also moved significantly higher.
 
Litecoin (LTC)
 
Litecoin (LTC) rose by as much as 15% to start the week, as cryptocurrency markets rebounded from recent losses.
 
LTC/USD surged to an intraday high of $79.53 earlier in today’s session, less than 24 hours after hitting a low of $68.66.
 
The move saw litecoin climb to its strongest point since last Friday, when the token was at a peak of $84.92.
 
 
Looking at the chart, one catalyst of the move appears to be the 14-day relative strength index (RSI), which broke out of a recent resistance point.
 
As of writing, the index is tracking at 41.05, following a move beyond the aforementioned ceiling at 40.00.
 
Should momentum continue in this direction, there is a strong chance that LTC bulls will take price to a ceiling at $85.00.
 
 
Ethereum Classic (ETC)
 
In addition to LTC, ethereum classic (ETC) also rebounded from recent lows during Monday’s session.
 
Following a low of $17.05 on Sunday, ETC/USD raced to a peak of $20.20 to start the week.
 
This high has also acted as a point of resistance in recent weeks, and since a collision earlier in the day, bullish momentum has marginally eased.
 
 
At the time of writing, ETC/USD is trading at $19.65, which is still nearly 15% higher than yesterday’s bottom.
 
Overall, it appears that previous bulls have moved to secure gains, as the RSI nears a ceiling of its own at 48.00.
 
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
 
Will this uptrend continue for the remainder of the week? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.
articles.title: Biggest Movers: LTC, ETC 15% Higher, as Crypto Markets Rebound on Monday

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
The rise of blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies has created new avenues for financial services. The emergence of decentralized finance (DeFi), a new paradigm for financial services based on blockchain technology, is one of the most significant developments in this space.

In this article, we will look at what DeFi is, what it offers, and how it has the potential to transform the financial services industry.

What is DeFi?

Decentralized finance (DeFi) is a system of financial applications and services based on a blockchain network that is decentralized. Unlike traditional financial services, which are centralized and controlled by large institutions like banks and governments, DeFi is a decentralized system that anyone with an internet co…
articles.title: Decentralized Finance: A New Paradigm for Financial Services

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
The concept of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) is gaining traction as the world shifts toward a digital economy. CBDCs are digital forms of fiat currency issued and backed by a central bank and intended for use as a medium of exchange for goods and services.

While CBDCs have numerous potential benefits, they also have significant drawbacks that must be considered.

CBDCs and Their Potential

One of the most compelling arguments for CBDCs is that they may provide a more secure and efficient alternative to traditional cash and banking systems.

Digital currencies, unlike physical cash, are stored on a secure, tamper-proof blockchain network that is virtually impossible to hack. As a result, CBDCs may reduce the risk of fraud and othe…
articles.title: The Promise and Pitfalls of Central Bank Digital Currencies

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
The United States which has always been the world’s second leading country in technology after Japan is about to step down to lose its race as a leader in cryptocurrency innovation and technology.
 
Over the past years, the US has been keen on regulating the industry, and while that is not a problem, the regulators have portrayed to be against the industry more than been interested in regulating it. 
 
Could this be the downfall of the US in the race to lead the crypto revolution? A prominent lawyer suggests it could be.
 
US Sabotaging Its Crypto Revolution Leadership Race?
 
The industry has been facing a lot of ups and downs, a weakness that the US regulators have been leveraging to crack down on the industry. The recent fallout of crypto-friendly major banks has been the latest inciden…
articles.title: US Could Fall Behind In The Race To Lead Crypto Revolution, Here’s Why

articles.author: Amitoj Singh
articles.description: The recent collapses of crypto banks have only underscored the hesitancy of the Group of 20 (G-20) on crypto assets, a highly placed G-20 source said.
articles.title: Bank Collapses Underscore G-20 Hesitance on Crypto: Source

articles.author: Boyd Cohen
articles.description: Stepn is a cautionary tale for M2E startup founders like me. But I see a better model in Sweatcoin, which leveraged real-life utility to amass over 100 million users before going on-chain, writes Iomob CEO Boyd Cohen.
articles.title: Move-to-Earn Has a Ponzi-Economics Problem

articles.author: Sam White
articles.description:
By now, everyone is aware of the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, the panic that ensued as a result, and, going into a new week, the solution that has been struck upon.

As a brief overview, the failure of Silicon Valley Bank is the biggest US banking collapse since 2008, but has been summarized as a conventional bank run. The bank had invested largely in treasury bonds, but rises in interest rates then forced it to sell off assets at a $1.8 billion loss, and launch a $2.2 billion share sale.

Investors became spooked very quickly and a run ensued, ensuring, essentially, that it was all over for the sixteenth largest US lender. Then, over the weekend, federal regulators moved to prevent the damage spiraling out of control, ensuring that all depositors would have access t…
articles.title: Crypto Spooked and Suspicious after Silicon Valley Bank's Collapse

articles.author: Jack Schickler
articles.description: Germany’s Markus Ferber said there needs to be a review of interest rate and sovereign bond exposures.
articles.title: Panic Mustn’t Be Allowed to Spread After SVB Collapse: EU Lawmaker

articles.author: Nikhilesh De
articles.description: The government on Sunday evening stepped in to guarantee no losses will be borne by the lenders' depositors.
articles.title: President Biden Calls for Stronger Bank Regulations in Wake of SVB, Signature Bank Collapses

articles.author: Oliver Knight
articles.description: Traders using decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols to bet on a USDC revival over the weekend are at risk of eight-figure liquidations if the stablecoin loses its $1 peg again this week.
articles.title: $70M in Fresh On-Chain USDC Positions at Risk of Liquidation if Stablecoin Depegs by 10%

articles.author: Ian Allison
articles.description: The Spacewalk bridge built by recent parachain winner Pendulum is focused on connecting DeFi to forex markets.
articles.title: Crypto Payments Specialist Stellar Bridges Fiat and Stablecoins to Polkadot

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
In the wake of the Silicon Valley Bank collapse, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse has assured investors that the company is in a strong financial position. 
 
There have been several cases of shuttered banks this month, which has affected many crypto firms. Some top banks, including Silvergate, Silicon Valley, and Signature bank, have shut down operations tying many firms’ funds in their vaults.
 
 
Top crypto firms such as Coinbase, Paxos, Celsius, and Circle have been affected due to their exposure to some banks. Also, many crypto assets traded in the red last week due to the bank’s crashes. 
 
Ripple Holds Strong Financial Position Despite SVB Collapse
 
In a Twitter post, Garlinghouse stated that while the loss of SVB was a blow, Ripple is doing enough to sustain normal operations on the n…
articles.title: Brad Garlinghouse Encourages Ripple Community Following SVB Collapse

articles.author: Jack Schickler
articles.description: The company had millions deposited with Silicon Valley Bank, but regulators intervened Sunday evening to safeguard all  customer monies.
articles.title: BlockFi Has Cash Access for Staff, Vendors Despite SVB Collapse: Attorney

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The U.S. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) has announced that clients of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and Signature Bank (SBNY) can access their funds during normal banking hours on Monday, March 13, 2023. The FDIC stated that both banks’ deposits were made whole under the “systemic risk exception” approved by the U.S. Federal Reserve and Treasury Department.
 
Details on the Creation of Full-Service FDIC-Operated Bridge Banks
 
Customers who utilized Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) and Signature Bank (SBNY) will have access to their funds on Monday, following the FDIC’s actions to transform both banks into newly created full-service FDIC-operated bridge banks. SVB will now be known as “Silicon Valley Bank N.A.,” while Signature’s new name is “Signature Bridge Bank N.A.” Both bridge bank…
articles.title: FDIC Creates Bridge Banks for Failed Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank Clients to Access Funds

articles.author: Eliza Gkritsi
articles.description: Marathon terminated a credit facility with Silvergate last week.
articles.title: Bitcoin Miner Marathon Says It Still Has Access to $142M at Signature Bank

articles.author: Nikhilesh De
articles.description: The Circle-issued USDC stablecoin regained its peg to the U.S. dollar after falling below the $1 value it was supposed to hold late Friday hours after Silicon Valley Bank was shuttered by state and federal regulators.
articles.title: USDC Stablecoin Regains Dollar Peg After Silicon Valley Bank-Induced Chaos

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data shows the crypto futures liquidations have hit $238 million during the last 24 hours as Bitcoin has observed an uplift of 10%.
 
Bitcoin Liquidations Reach $238 million
 
Whenever an investor opens a futures contract on any derivative exchange, they first have to put forth some initial collateral called the margin. Such a contract can get liquidated if the holder amasses losses that have eaten away a specific portion of this margin.
 
By “liquidation,” what is meant here is that the derivative exchange forcefully closes the contract when losses of this specific degree are accumulated (the exact percentage may differ from platform to platform).
 
One factor that can raise the risk of any contract getting liquidated is “leverage.” The leverage is a loan amount that a holder may choose t…
articles.title: Crypto Liquidations Hit $238 Million As Bitcoin Jumps 10%

articles.author: Jeff  Wilser
articles.description: January’s tennis grand slam shows how brands can embrace the metaverse for increased fan engagement.
articles.title: The Australian Open Goes Full Web3
